definition: to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to make fun of/to seek diversion

sentences.english: You can have a lot of fun for cheap close to campus.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在校园附近玩得很开心，而且花钱也不多。

sentences.english: I hope you HAs a maximum glad or prosperous New Year.
sentences.chinese: 谨祝新年愉快开心，大吉大利。

sentences.english: Joyfully, he embraced and kissed his parents and Aksah.
sentences.chinese: 他开心地拥抱，亲吻他的父母，还有阿克萨。

sentences.english: Sam bought Nancy some flowers to cheer her up.
sentences.chinese: 山姆买了一些花给南西，好逗她开心。

sentences.english: Try to make at least three people smile a day.
sentences.chinese: 请大显身手，每天至少引领三个人开心张笑口。

sentences.english: Center Street is a good place to have fun.
sentences.chinese: 中心街是一个能够玩得开心的地方。

sentences.english: And then you come across this joyful book.
sentences.chinese: 然后你选择转看令人开心的书籍。

sentences.english: We'll do all we can to make Vincenzo happy.
sentences.chinese: 我们会尽全力让文琴佐感到开心。

sentences.english: We have a lot of fun at the fairground today.
sentences.chinese: 我们今天在游乐场上玩得很开心。

sentences.english: Happy baccarat is a classic casino game.
sentences.chinese: 开心百家乐是经典赌场游戏。

sentences.english: Amused, the shopkeeper asked what I wanted this alleged green leaf for.
sentences.chinese: 菜店老板就很开心地问我要这种绿色的叶子做什么用。

sentences.english: Such things can never make my heart rejoice.
sentences.chinese: 安能摧眉折腰事权贵，使我不得开心颜。

sentences.english: Is there any way we can have some fun ?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么好办法让我们开开心？

sentences.english: His future was uncertain, but he did not believe it could be unhappier than his past.
sentences.chinese: 他对将来仍一片迷茫，但他相信会比过去过得开心。

sentences.english: The children are always up to amusing tricks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们总是调皮捣蛋寻开心。

sentences.english: She was very happy to wear his-and-hers clothing.
sentences.chinese: 她对于穿情侣装表现得十分开心。

definition: happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
